szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.intrfc.arena.actors.pipe

Interface PipeBasic


  • public interface PipeBasic
    The interface for the pipe exposed to the player to use for collecting treasures (their collection happens automatically as the pipe moves).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PipeSegment calculateNextSegment(Direction dir)
      A method to calculate the segment to push onto the segment stack according to the Direction the player wants to move in.
      PipeHead getHead()
      Returns the head of the pipe which automatically collects treasure when it moves and which possesses a weapon.
      int getHealth()
      Returns a value in the range 0 to 100 representing the percentage to which the pipe is undamaged.
      Stack<PipeSegment> getSegmentStack(PlayerToken token)
      Returns a modifiable stack of pipe segments representing the pipe from the base of the pipe (stack bottom) to the segment connecting to the pipe head (stack top).
      boolean intersects(ActorBasic actor)
      Checks if the given actor intersects with this pipe.
      boolean isWall(Direction dir)
      Checks if there is a wall in front of the pipe head (it just checks if the adjacent TunnelCell) in the specified Direction from the heads current position is null or not.

    • Method Detail

      • getHead

        PipeHead getHead()

        Returns the head of the pipe which automatically collects treasure when it moves and which possesses a weapon.

        Returns:
        The head of the pipe.

      • getSegmentStack

        Stack<PipeSegment> getSegmentStack(PlayerToken token)

        Returns a modifiable stack of pipe segments representing the pipe from the base of the pipe (stack bottom) to the segment connecting to the pipe head (stack top). This stack is modifiable via Stack.push(Object) and Stack.pop() and changing the stack this way causes the pipe head to move.

        Parameters:
        token - the token of the player owning this pipe. If a value of null or an invalid token is passed, this method returns an unmodifiable view of the actual stack, meaning push() and pop() result in an exception being thrown.
        Returns:
        The stack of PipeSegments representing the pipe.

      • calculateNextSegment

        PipeSegment calculateNextSegment(Direction dir)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        A method to calculate the segment to push onto the segment stack according to the Direction the player wants to move in.

        This method is made purely for convenience purposes, to unburden the person calling Stack.push(Object) from having to implement calculating the segment manually.

        Parameters:
        dir - the direction the player wishes to move the head to
        Returns:
        the pipe segment required to move the pipe head in the specified direction
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if null or an unknown Direction enum value is passed as parameter

      • isWall

        boolean isWall(Direction dir)

        Checks if there is a wall in front of the pipe head (it just checks if the adjacent TunnelCell) in the specified Direction from the heads current position is null or not.

        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to check in.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the adjacent cell is null | false otherwise.

      • intersects

        boolean intersects(ActorBasic actor)

        Checks if the given actor intersects with this pipe.

        Parameters:
        actor - the actor to check.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the actor intersects | false otherwise.

      • getHealth

        int getHealth()

        Returns a value in the range 0 to 100 representing the percentage to which the pipe is undamaged.

        Returns:
        the current degree to which the pipe is undamaged as a percentage.
